text: Inauguration of the Commonwealth (or Inauguration of the Australian Commonwealth) was a 1901 Australian documentary film made by the Limelight Department of the Salvation Army in Australia. It was commissioned by the Government of New South Wales to record the Commonwealth Celebration Day. It was Australia's first feature-length documentary film, going for 35 minutes. According to the Salvation Army's website, "it was five times the length of any earlier Australian film and was the first Australian film to use simultaneous multiple-camera coverage; it was the most widely distributed Australian film of its time.""Australia's First Film Studio" at Salvation Army Much of the footage still survives today.Film information at National Film and Sound Archive ==References== ==External links== * *Film information at National Film and Sound Archive Category:Australian documentary films Category:Australian films Category:1901 films Category:1900s documentary films Category:Black-and-white documentary films Category:1901 in Australia Category:Salvationism in Australia Category:Films set in New South Wales Category:Australian silent short films Category:Limelight Department films
title: Inauguration of the Commonwealth
